headline: Inside Politics
subHeadline: Alex Murdaugh Cross-Examined In His Murder Trial. Aired 12:30- 1p ET

utterances.speaker: ALEX MURDAUGH, MURDER DEFENDANT
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: CREIGHTON WATERS, PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: That's when you went back to the kennels after you came back from Almeda, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I went to the kennels after I went to the house. I went from Almeda, to the house, to the kennels.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And we got to the scene. You got out of the car, according to what you told law enforcement repeatedly, and went and checked the bodies, correct? Before you called 911, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, that's not correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're saying you didn't say that to law enforcement?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know what I said to law enforcement, Mr. Waters, but I can tell you this. I pulled up and I saw Maggie and Pawpaw. I jumped out of that car. I noted I went back to my car and I called 911 as quickly as I could. That point in time, when I got on the phone then is when I went to them and did the things that I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So but you were --

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But you're saying is not accurate.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're saying that you didn't say very specifically the law enforcement that you went to them prior to calling 911.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: When?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: After you got out of the car, you told law enforcement repeatedly that you went over and checked the bodies before you called 911?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't -- if I did say that, I don't believe that's accurate. Did I check Maggie and Paul before I called 911?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. That's not -- I don't -- that's not accurate. At least that's not what I remember. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, that's not what I believe happened.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK, but you don't deny that's what you said?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Did I said, did I check Maggie and Paul before I called 911?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that's what I said. Now, I know I checked them, but I don't believe I checked them before I called 911. Because I can pretty well remember vividly. When I checked Pawpaw, I was already on the phone with 911.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Looking at this data, did show the vehicle parking at 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry, say that again, Mr. Waters.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: At 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: The 911 call was at 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Just about 20 seconds later. Do you agree with that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I think that sounds right. Yes, sir. I mean, that makes sense. But that goes back to what I'm saying is I pulled up, I saw -- I saw them, and I know I jumped out of my car. But I believe that before I checked them, in fact, I'm almost certain that then I went back and I got my -- that's when I went and got my phone and I called 911.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And then after I called 911, they -- I mean, there was a little while where there wasn't -- I don't think there was anything going on. And I believe that that is the time period that I went and checked on them.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I don't want to go to this point, but that what you're saying here today, now that we have this data, that's not exactly how you expressed it to law enforcement in your prior statements, is that correct? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I totally disagree with that, Mr. Waters. Will you point to what you're talking about?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Sure.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: DAVID OWEN, SLED AGENT
utterances.sentences: All right, sir. (INAUDIBLE). All right, Mr. Murdaugh, state your full name for me, please.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Richard Alexander Murdaugh.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: Can you spell your last name so it would be correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: M-U-R-D-A-U-G-H.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: All right. And you go by Alex?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: And date of birth, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: Phone number for you?

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: All right. And, sir, what was your name?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Damien Anderson (ph).

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK. All right, as I stated, I'm David Owen and (INAUDIBLE) on this county. I'm a SLED. I have to do this.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I understand. I totally understand. So you don't have any problem with it.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: Yes. So just start to talk. Take your time.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Did you touch Maggie at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did. I touched them both.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I tried to take -- I mean, I tried to do it as limited as possible, but I tried to take their pulse on both of them. And, you know, I called 911 pretty much right away. And she was very good. I talked to her. I told her I was going to get off the phone to call some family members. I did that. And --

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: What family members did you call in?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I called my brother Randy, and I called my brother John. And I tried to call a little boy, real good friend that's right around the corner from here, but I didn't get him.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That person (INAUDIBLE) right around the corner? Is that who you're talking about?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's correct. But going back to your question, I mean, that's the way I remember it what I said right there. And, you know, your question about did I do these things before I called 911, that's not what I said then, and that's not what I remember now.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So you're saying now that you went out, checked, you came back, got your phone, and that's when you called 911?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not saying that now, Mr. Waters. I am saying that now. But to me, that's what I said then. I mean, I told her I called 911 right away. I didn't have -- there was no time to do the things that I'm talking about doing in the time between getting there and calling 911.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When you talked about calling Rogan, and you said that he lived right around the corner, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. But Rogan wasn't staying there at the time. That's the whole reason the Cash was at your kennel, right? You knew that.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, Rogan was staying in Buford a lot, but he was home a lot, too. I didn't know where Rogan was on a daily basis.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) you about keeping his dog Cash at the kennels when he was staying with his girlfriend and working down in Buford?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, he had asked me that. But, I mean, that had been some time before. I didn't know making a big deal about this, Mr. Waters, but that particular night, I didn't have a clue where Rogan was staying or not staying. I was trying to find somebody to come out there with me. I'd called Randy, I'd called John, and Rogan was the next best alternative.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And Rogan is so close. I mean, Rogan, of all these kids that you've heard, Rogan Gibson -- Rowrow (ph) is like Rogan. Prefer when I call him, Rogan, is truly like a son to Maggie and I. And he was such a good friend of Buster and he was such a good friend to Paul.And you've been through everything I have. You'll see that two weeks or three weeks prior to this, I ran out of gas when Bus and Pawpaw weren't home. And Rogan is the person that I called to bring me gas.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Nobody's disputing any that Rogan would have helped you. Let me keep playing this.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) Paul, what do (INAUDIBLE)?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Blood.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: Any other things? Anything else?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I mean, there was somebody thing. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. None. No. None. No sir.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: About Maggie?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: You didn't say anything around, though? What made you come out here tonight?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I went to -- my mom's late-stage Alzheimer's patient, my dad's in the hospital. My mom gets anxious when she does. I went to check on them, and Maggie's a dog lover, and she fools with the dogs. And I knew she'd gone to the kennel. I was at the house.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You just testified that in the wake of this, you didn't know what you said to law enforcement. That was what you just said? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. But right then and there, just not long into this interview, made a conscious decision to lie right there.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Say that again.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You said, I was at the house.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I knew she'd gone to the kennel. I was at the house. I left the --(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You played --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You want me to back it up some more?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we can keep listening to it.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: Anything around, though? What made you come out here tonight?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I went to -- my mom's late-stage Alzheimer's patient, my dad's in the hospital. My mom gets anxious when she does. I went to check on them, and Maggie's a dog lover, and she fools with the dogs. And I knew she'd gone to the kennel. I was at the house.

utterances.speaker: OWEN
utterances.sentences: OK.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You want to hear it again?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. But I don't think --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You made a conscious decision to lie right there this early into an interview sitting in the front seat, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You didn't make a conscious decision to lie?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that was lying at that point.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Tell me why not.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because Maggie had gone to the kennels and I was at the house.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So you think you were being -- that was not a lie at that point?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: At what point did you decide to lie?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure, but it was in that --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: It was in this interview?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe that it was.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Was this interview where you're sitting in the front seat, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're not in custody, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not in custody.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: They're giving you water, letting you chew tobacco, treating you politely, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: They were treating me very politely.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So what was it that they clicked? So you said this interview that it clicked, that I'm going to lie about the most important fact that I know.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure exactly when in it that I lied, decided to lie, but I believe it was during this interview. I believe all those things that I talked about, you know, those things that had gone on, the things that people have said tome about don't talk to anybody without a lawyer.Partners all told me that. A lot of my partners told me that. My dear friend Chief Alexander was one who said that. I overheard I believe it was Sheriff Hill, I'm not positive. I overheard him tell I believe Mark Ball or Gray Homes (ph) don't let him talk to anybody without a lawyer. And what I believe is that based on my distrust of SLED and getting in that interview -- and I'm not positive about this, but I believe when he asked me, you know, about my relationship with my wife and my son, I believe that's when I decided to lie. But I'm not positive.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're not so left out when you had the GSR, too, because that's what you testified to that yesterday.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That certainly contributed.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And your dope paranoia too. You said that as well, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, those things are what triggered the paranoia that started as my addiction evolved.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So, you're an experienced lawyer and you've been a prosecutor, and you took the advice of your law partners that you should have a lawyer there as -- you read that as, oh, I should lie.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, that's not accurate.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So that's not what that means, is it, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: -- as a lawyer and a prosecutor?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, that's what you said, Mr. Waters, but I --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm mischaracterizing it from your perspective, Mr. Murdaugh.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Because I think that's -- that ain't what you heard? And that what you just said? Excuse me.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, that's not what I said.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Say it again.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe those guys were trying to help me. I believe they cared about me. I believe they thought that I was in a condition such that I shouldn't talk to anybody. I mean, those guys had to prop me up, help me get myself together just to be able to go talk to David Owens. I mean, they were trying to help me.But before that, that was just one of the many things that I believe led to that situation. Sitting in there where those paranoid thoughts came to me. Them talking about not talking to anybody without a lawyer. Brian Varnado (ph) checking my hands. The fact that I got a pocket full of pills in my pocket. I was the person who found Maggie and Paul, my distrust for SLED, all of those factors combined and made me decide to lie. I also know him asking me about Maggie and Pawpaw contributed to that paranoia. All I'm saying is I'm not disputing that I lied. I'm just saying at this point you're saying and I made a conscious decision to lie here, and I'm saying I don't think I made a conscious decision right there.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK, so liar. MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Have you already had your GSR done at this point?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I had.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you already talked to your law partners and talked to and heard Sheriff Hill. And now you're blaming him, and blaming --

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: -- and Chief Alexander now as well, for your lies?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. Mr. Waters, I'm not --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You just added that one. You didn't say that yesterday, and you just added that one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Please, if you give an opportunity to answer the question.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Objection.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) you can finish your last answer.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Mr. Waters, I'm not blaming anybody. I accept full responsibility for what I did. What I'm saying is what I believe contributed to me doing that and the reason why I did that. I think those folks were trying to help me, so I don't blame them. I think they were worried about me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. I don't dispute that. But you're saying you took that advice as I need to lie.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. What you're doing is you're isolating one single thing --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm not isolating anything. I've mentioned all the factors. You've added some new ones, but I mentioned all the factors that you're blaming your obsession to lie.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's not what you did. What you asked me is you said, I took my partners telling me not to talk to somebody without a lawyer as a reason to lie, and that's an inaccurate statement. That was one of the factors that went into a series --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Your reason to lie.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Hang on, Mr. Waters. A series of events, right, that caused me to have paranoid thinking, right, and then I lied. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I certainly didn't go into that interview, I believe intended a lot.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Mr. Waters, I wasn't capable at that point in time of planning anything or thinking through anything.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So somehow during this interview, all of a sudden, those senses came to you to plan and do that?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Those are the clothes that you ultimately gave to Dave Owen, is that right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Those are the clothes I gave to David Owens.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: At what point did you get -- be able to chuck the pills you say are in your pocket? When did you do that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: When I was in my bedroom.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When you're in the bedroom?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Where did you put them?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure where I put them, but ultimately they would have gone in my suitcase.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So that's when you did it. Do you have a specific recollection of that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't. I just know that I took them out of my pocket.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: If we watched this whole video, you think you could -- if we watch the whole thing, you think you can say, OK, that's the moment where my senses came to me and I decided I was going to tell this major lie. MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: We've heard that. I just want to be clear, though, at least on this one, at some point during this interview, when you were able to plan your lie about this event and you made that decision. But it wasn't what we just played. It wasn't yet. It was some point after that.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't think that's a lie right there, is the reason why I don't think that it's occurred before this because what I'm saying there --

utterances.speaker: JOHN KING, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I'm John King in Washington. You're watching Alex Murdaugh on the stand, day two of cross examination in his double murder trial in Walterboro, South Carolina. The prosecution just moments ago playing the tape of the defendant's initial answers to police on the night of the murders to highlight what they call his ever-changing story.Back to this dramatic testimony after a quick break.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I may be wrong, but I believe that this was before that.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: ABBY PHILLIP, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Hello. I'm Abby Phillip in Washington. I'm going to get you right back to the Alex Murdaugh trial underway right now in South Carolina.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You told David Owen that you understood that the he had to ask questions and you do what you need to do, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That is what I told him.Your Honor, this might be a good time for a break.
